commentBody: Nothing surprises me anymore.  I didn't think it was possible but now I think America could go full bore fascist.

replies.commentBody: Yes, it is scary. It seems Trump is a backlash against the political correctness of contemporary times.

Not "political correctness" but political corruption. When you keep voting for the same type of pols owned by big money (i.e. Hillary Clinton and most of Congress), this is what you get. Ross Perot proved many Americans felt this way by getting 19 million votes in 1992 (and that was after he dropped out of the prez race and got back in). So, this anti--establishment feeling from many Americans is not knew. It is just economic conditions have worsened making people angrier and they are more of them then they were in 1992.

That's right out of his mouth. But that so-called political correctness includes racial and ethnic tolerance, along with an antipathy for authoritarian behavior. Trump's just made it ok for all those, both Repub- and Dem-leaning, to take off the mask and show their racist/authoritarian tendencies if they have them. This, and not Trump's political views, which except for immigration and the Muslim stuff, are actually relatively moderate, is the real reason people are flocking to him. The immigration and Muslim business is just racism in a different coat, called xenophobia. That, and they want to nuke Washington, and he seems like the guy to do it.
